_comment: Created by NCODowd on 27/07/2016 12:17:05 using v2.7
title: How has the proportion of cancelled operations changed?
analysis_commentary:
In Q4 2014/15 there were 23,180 elective operations cancelled from a total of nearly two million elective operations performed, which represents 1.2% of all elective admissions.

This ratio of cancelled elective operations has decreased over the time period covered by the data. The number of cancelled operations as a percentage of elective admissions was 1.2% in Q4 2015/16 as it was in Q4 in 1994/95. During this same period, the number of elective admissions has risen by 62%, suggesting that not only has the NHS been able to cope with the increasing demand, it has been able to improve on previous performance.

When looking at the ratio instead of absolute numbers it does not, however, remove the seasonal variation seen with the absolute numbers.

Updated July 2016.
